title: SoftBank to Take Majority Stake in WeWork as Adam Neumann Gets Big Payout
text:
WeWork’s board has approved a proposal from SoftBank Group to take control of its parent, We Co., The Wall Street Journal reported Tuesday morning. The deal reportedly calls for WeWork co-founder Adam Neumann to receive nearly $1.7 billion and surrender his posts as chairman and a director.

The Journal said WeWork chose a rescue proposal from SoftBank (ticker: 9984.Japan) over a competitive offer from JPMorgan Chase (JPM), although one source familiar with the situation told Barron’s that JPMorgan never made a serious alternative...
description: The deal reportedly calls for the WeWork co-founder to receive nearly $1.7 billion and surrender his posts as chairman and a director.
